main event: A UFO sighting occurred in Akron, Ohio on March 16, 1958, involving a yellowish-white stationary light which disappeared after 3 minutes observed by ground radar and visually.
interesting points: The sighting involved an unidentified yellowish-white light that remained stationary for 3 minutes before disappearing.
The object was detected by ground radar and observed visually, indicating a multi-modal observation.
Witnesses from the Ohio State Patrol reported tracking an unidentified green ball or haze traveling to the east at around 2000 feet.
Sgt. Jf. J. Martino of the Ohio Highway Patrol observed an object floating and gliding in the sky near the Ohio Turnpike, disappearing after about 10 minutes.
Analysis of material turned over to the Ohio State Highway Patrol revealed it to be strips of foil known as 'Mylar' used in radar operations.
witnesses: Ohio State Patrol, Ohio Highway Patrol
